info.title: Products
info.description: List stores, categories, and items configured in the Direct Scale Commission Engine.

get.description: The DirectScale commission engine contains a collection of "stores". Products and product categories are categorized into specific "stores". For instance, Retail, Wholesale, etc., listings that contain products and categories.

200.description: Returns an array of valid Store objects.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description: Get a list of categories to a specific store.

parameters.name: storeId
parameters.description: The ID of the Store whose Categories are to be retrieved.

200.description: Returns an array of valid Category objects.

404.description: A Store with the given Store ID was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description: Return all items in a given country and category. Optional filter parameters will limit translations, prices, and products returned.

parameters.name: categoryId
parameters.description: The Id of the Category whose Items are to be retrieved.

parameters.name: CurrencyCode
parameters.description: The 3-character ISO currency code indicating pricing to be returned.

parameters.name: LanguageCode
parameters.description: The 2-character ISO language code indicating language of translations.

parameters.name: RegionID
parameters.description: The Region ID, fetched using "Get Regions"

parameters.name: PriceGroup
parameters.description: The Price Group ID, fetched using "Get Price Groups"

parameters.name: StoreID
parameters.description: The Store ID, fetched using "Get Stores"

200.description: Returns an array of valid Item objects.

examples.application/json:
[
  {
    "ItemID": 3,
    "Quantity": 1.0,
    "ExtendedPrice": 50.0,
    "ExtendedBonus": 0.0,
    "ExtendedCV": 0.0,
    "ExtendedQV": 0.0,
    "ProductName": "Example Item",
    "Description": "Long Description",
    "Specifications": "Long Specifications",
    "LanguageCode": "en",
    "SKU": "ipd",
    "ChargeShipping": false,
    "FlagCancer": false,
    "FlagBirthDefects": false,
    "HasKitGroups": false,
    "Price": 50.0,
    "Bonus": 0.0,
    "CV": 0.0,
    "QV": 0.0,
    "CurrencyCode": "usd",
    "OriginalPrice": 50.0,
    "Cost": 0.0,
    "ExtendedRewardPoints": 0.0,
    "ExtendedCost": 0.0,
    "Category": "Electronics",
    "Height": 0.0,
    "ImageUrl": "/ipod_nano_1.jpg",
    "Length": 0.0,
    "MPN": "",
    "PackCount": 0.0,
    "PackageGroupID": 1,
    "TaxClassID": 0,
    "UnitOfMeasure": "",
    "UPC": "",
    "Weight": 0.0,
    "Width": 0.0,
    "PriceGroup": 1,
    "RewardPoints": 0.0
  }
]

404.description: A Category with the given Category ID was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description: Retrieves an Item based on a valid Item ID.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The Id of the Item to retrieve.

application/json.Description: This is a great decorative item featuring a lovely Lady Bug.

404.description: An Item with the given Item ID was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description: Retrieves an Item based on a valid Item Stock Keeping Unit (SKU).

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: The SKU of the Item to retrieve.

parameters.name: CurrencyCode
parameters.description: The 3-character ISO currency code indicating pricing to be returned.

parameters.name: LanguageCode
parameters.description: The 2-character ISO language code indicating language of translations.

application/json.Description: This is a great decorative item featuring a lovely Lady Bug.

404.description: An Item with the given Item SKU was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description: Retrieves an array of Sub Categories.

parameters.name: categoryId
parameters.description: The ID of the Category whose Sub Categories are to be retrieved.

200.description: Returns an array of valid Sub Category objects.

404.description: A Category with the given Category ID was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

200.description: Returns an array of valid Region objects.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

schema.example:
{
    "Sku": "API_ITEM_SKU",
    "KitLevel": 0,
    "Category": {
        "Id": 0 //Call GetCategories for Options
    },
    "ChargeShipping": true,
    "Disabled": false,
    "Height": 0.0,
    "Image": "/path_to_image.jpg",
    "Length": 0.0,
    "LengthUnitOfMeasure": "in | cm | mm",
    "ManufacturerPartNum": "Manufacturer Part Number",
    "OutOfStockStatus": 1, // 1: In Stock | 2: 2-3 Days | 3: Out Of Stock | 4: Pre-Order
    "PackCount": 0.0,
    "PackageGroupId": 1, // 1: Standard
    "PreferedVendorId": 0,
    "SortOrder": 0,
    "TaxClassId": 0,
    "ProductClass": 1, // 1: Standard Item | 2: Raw Material
    "TrackStock": true,
    "UnitOfMeasure": "ea | kg | gr | lb | oz | cm | mm | in | ft | yd",
    "Upc": "Universal Product Code",
    "Weight": 0.0,
    "WeightUnitOfMeasure": "kg | gr | lb | oz",
    "Width": 0.0,
    "FlagCancer": false,
    "FlagBirthDefects": false,
    "HasKitGroups": false,
    "HsCode": "Harmonized Tariff Commodity Code",
    "FastStart": {
        "Gen1": 0,
        "Gen2": 0,
        "Gen3": 0,
        "Gen4": 0,
        "Gen5": 0,
        "Gen6": 0,
        "Gen7": 0,
        "Gen8": 0,
        "Gen9": 0,
        "Gen10": 0
    },
    "Images": [{
            "Description": "string",
            "Path": "string"
        }
    ],
    "Languages": [{
            "Description": "Product Description Here",
            "LanguageCode": "en",
            "ProductName": "Product Name Here",
            "SeoKeywords": null,
            "Specifications": "Product Specification Here"
        }
    ],
    "Options": [{
            "Option": "Option Category Name",
            "OptionType": 1, // 1: Standard
            "Values": [{
                    "Option": "Option Name",
                    "SkuExt": "OPTION_SKU"
                }
            ]
        }
    ],
    "OptionsMap": [], // Keep this as an empty array
    "Discounts": [{
            "Bonus": 0.00, // Nullable
            "End": "01-01-9999",
            "Price": 0.00,
            "PriceCurrency": "usd",
            "Cv": 0.0,
            "Qv": 0.0,
            "RewardPointsEarned": 0.0,
            "Start": "01-01-1900",
            "Type": "Discount | Price",
            "Stores": [
                0 // Call GetStores for Options
            ],
            "OrderType": [
                0 // 0: Corporate | 1: Wholesale | 2: Retail | 3: Enroll | 4: AutoShip | 5: Rewards | 6: Party
            ],
            "PriceGroups": [
                0 // 0: Stylist | 1: Customer | 2: Preferred Customer
            ],
            "Regions": [
                0 // Call GetRegions for Options
            ]
        }
    ]
}

201.description: The new item was created successfully.

get.description: Return an array of all available items.

200.description: Returns an array of all Item objects.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The Id of the item to update.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The Id of the item to delete.

get.description: Retrieves Stock Level information for Item based on a valid Item ID and Warehouse ID.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The ID of the Item to retrieve.

parameters.name: warehouseId
parameters.description: The ID of the Warehouse for the given Item to retrieve.

200.description: Returns a valid Stock Level object.

404.description: An Item with the given Item ID or Warehouse ID was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

put.description: Sets the On Hand stock level for the given Warehouse and Item

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The ItemId of the item for which you are adjusting stock.

200.description: The stock level for the item was successfully updated.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.
